command: sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 443 -m string --string "beacon.example" --algo bm -m recent --name T1205_TLS_SNI --set -j LOG --log-prefix "T1205_TLS_SNI "
explanation: Matches TLS ClientHello SNI strings containing a covert keyword/host (beacon.example) as an activation signal, demonstrating application-layer traffic signaling over TLS.
rationale_steps: Leverage visibility of plaintext SNI during TLS handshake to find covert triggers.
Track and log sources presenting signaling SNI values.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed iptables command with valid modules and flags, balanced quotes, and a proper LOG target with prefix.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly detects/logs TLS:443 ClientHello payloads containing the SNI substring and tags sources via recent, but lacks TLS awareness (may miss fragmented/ECH traffic) and the stated privilege level is inconsistent with requiring sudo.
